context: preoperative diagnosis: tonsillitis. postoperative diagnosis: tonsillitis.
mcivor mouth gag was placed in the oral cavity and a tongue depressor applied.
the anterior tonsillar pillar was infiltrated with 1.5 cc of 1% xylocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine, as was the left tonsillar pillar.
the pack was removed and bleeding was controlled with the suction bovie unit.
the nasopharynx was inspected with the laryngeal mirror.
the patient tolerated the procedure well and left the operating room in good condition.
